alert.note: Alert for Glasscock; Howard; Mitchell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 12 at 5:39PM CDT until May 12 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN GLASSCOCK, SOUTHEASTERN HOWARD AND CENTRAL MITCHELL COUNTIES... At 539 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 2 to 4 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Colorado City, Garden City, Loraine, Forsan, Lake Colorado City State Park, Lake Colorado City, Champion Creek Reservoir and Westbrook. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 between mile markers 201 and 226. Spotter reports road flooding at the intersection of FM 670 and County Road 337 south of Westbrook. Avoid the area. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2-4 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
